sections.MISSION:
3rd Squad, Comanche Troop, completes the Air Assault obstacle course IOT increase individual soldiering skills and evaluate physical fitness.
Task to Subordinate Units:
All Squads: Provide 2 safeties (E5+) to be used on a rotational basis.
sections.COORDINATING INSTRUCTIONS:
Uniform for training: OCPs
Uniform for non-training: OCPs
Transportation: Platoon internal
sections.CMD AND SIGNAL:
OIC: 2LT Harris
P: Cell Phone
A: Runner
sections.PURPOSE: Obstacle courses are a staple of army training and provide SM’s an opportunity to test their physical ability. This also allows for a benchmark to be recognized, influencing what needs to be improved or sustained within the platoon PT plans.
sections.KEY TASKS:
- Resource all obstacles with appropriate equipment and cadre
- Conduct deliberate rehearsal with cadre
- Provide robust C2 and medical coverage during
sections.END STATE: All SM’s will have tested their physical endurance and proficiency across a variety of obstacles; comradery and competitive spirit increased across the platoon.
sections.EXECUTION: Preparation and Planning: Designate 8 safeties (E5+) that are preferably Air Assault Qualified. Ensure there are 8 full water cans and 3 MREs per SM. Scheme of Maneuver: 3rd platoon will SP from land nav south in organic Strykers following the land nav course with 1st and 2nd platoons. 3rd platoon will then begin conducting the AAC 1 squad at a time starting NLT 0630. The last squad to conduct the AAC will provide safeties for the squad conducting the AAC. All squads will have completed the obstacle course NLT 1100, conducting an AAR following completion. Upon AAR completion 3rd platoon will SP to the ½ Squadron MP to conduct recovery as necessary.
sections.SUSTAINMENT:
Class I – M/M/M
Class III – Troop Internal
Class VIII – CLS bag in each squad
Land Navigation and Air Assault Course 15JUN22
AAC
Land Nav North
Obstacles/Route
